intro: Loasa inconspicua, commonly known as the creeping loasa, is a perennial flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, showy white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas and has a low, spreading habit with opposite, ovate leaves. Its botanical features include glandular hairs on the stems and leaves, which contribute to its distinctive appearance. Loasa inconspicua is often found in woodlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in humid, well-drained soils.
